programme.title: The Encore Hour
programme.desc: A look at some of the drama programmes coming up on the channel this month.

programme.title: The Ruth Rendell Mysteries
programme.desc: A man returns to his home town with a new wife, but finds himself haunted by traumatic memories and struggles to overcome the past. Drama from the pen of the celebrated author, starring Susannah York and John Castle.

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: The owner of a trawler is charged with manslaughter after his vessel sinks off the North Yorkshire coast, killing everyone on board except the captain. Kavanagh is assigned to prosecute but faces uproar from the local community, who refuse to believe it was deliberate. Legal drama, starring John Thaw and Nicholas Jones.

programme.title: Lillie
programme.desc: Shocked to discover her brief affair with Prince Louis has left her pregnant, Lillie seeks help from Arthur Jones.

programme.title: The Glass
programme.desc: Proctor's world comes crashing down around him as the true nature of his relationship with Duggan is revealed. Meanwhile, a pregnant Carol struggles to cope with her predicament as she puzzles over the identity of her unborn child's father, deciding to confront both men at the same time. Drama, starring John Thaw, Sarah Lancashire and Joseph McFadden. Last in the series.

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.desc: Newlyweds Mike and Ellie decide to build their dream home at a beauty spot called Gypsy's Acre, ignoring the warnings of elusive romany Mrs Lee about an ancient curse supposedly cast upon the land. The couple settle into their new life, but the mysterious woman makes her presence felt, subjecting them to a campaign of hatred in an attempt to force them out. Tragedy soon strikes, but as luck would have it Miss Marple is staying nearby with her recently widowed old friend Mrs Phillpot. However, if the spinster sleuth is to solve the puzzle, she must put her own life in grave danger. Murder mystery, starring Julia McKenzie, with Wendy Craig, Glynis Barber, Hugh Dennis, Tamzin Outhwaite, Tom Hughes, Joanna Vanderham, Aneurin Barnard, William Hope and Janet Henfrey.

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: Aircraft manufacturer Lord Mayfield hosts a party to trap a woman suspected of being a spy for the Germans. Fearing events might not go according to plan, Lady Mayfield decides to summon the famous Belgian detective to keep an eye on proceedings. Starring David Suchet, with John Stride and Phyllida Law.

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: A dentist falls in love with his young assistant. His anxious wife, believing he has made plans to poison her and thereby remove the main obstacle to happiness, calls for Poirot's help. Drama, starring David Suchet.

programme.title: Jordskott
programme.desc: Eva joins local police as they search the area around Silverhojd Lake for signs of her daughter Josefine, or the kidnapper, who is now believed to be responsible for the recent spate of abductions and the murders. However, her vested interest in the case has piqued the interest of colleague Tom, who remains suspicious of Eva's intentions. Swedish thriller, starring Moa Gammel.

programme.title: Safe House
programme.desc: Former policeman Robert and his wife Katy gave up their city lives after a witness in his care was shot dead, and he's been struggling with his guilt ever since. In an attempt to put the past behind them, the couple now run a guest house in the Lake District. But when old colleague DCI Mark Maxwell suggests the building would work as a safe house, Robert takes in a family whose members are under threat. It's a chance for him to make use of his detective skills and ensure nothing goes wrong this time. Drama, starring Christopher Eccleston, Marsha Thomason and Paterson Joseph.

programme.title: Safe House
programme.desc: Settled into the guest house, the Blackwells must pretend to be ordinary holiday-makers - with the aid of a script, it's vital they all know their cover story. When eldest son Sam's car is found damaged and abandoned, there's growing concern for his safety, but the police find a possible connection between him and a known criminal identified as the man targeting the family. As David, the father, continues to face questions from Robert, can he explain the large amounts of cash passing through his bank account?.

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: A heartbroken Sidney agrees to help parishioner Isabel prepare for her wedding to Arthur, the new man in town, but the bride's stubborn mother, Daisy, proves to be a big impediment to the occasion as she believes the groom is out to kill her. When Daisy is then found dead, Mrs Maguire calls in Geordie to investigate, and Sidney finds himself dragged into the case - despite vowing to leave police business behind. While the victim seems to have died of natural causes, Arthur and Isabel are pushing for a fast cremation, suggesting the couple have something to hide. Jean Marsh and Isla Blair guest star.

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: The owner of a trawler is charged with manslaughter after his vessel sinks off the North Yorkshire coast, killing everyone on board except the captain. Kavanagh is assigned to prosecute but faces uproar from the local community, who refuse to believe it was deliberate. Legal drama, starring John Thaw and Nicholas Jones.

programme.title: Cold Feet
programme.desc: Rachel returns to work and dates a younger man, Jenny convinces Adam to go on a blind date, and David and Karen both arrange surprise anniversary weekends for each other.

programme.title: The Encore Hour
programme.desc: A look at some of the drama programmes coming up on the channel this month.

programme.title: The Encore Hour
programme.desc: A look at some of the drama programmes coming up on the channel this month.

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: Hudson is angered by James's decision to invite his father's secretary to lunch in the family dining room, and promptly tenders his resignation. Shortly after his wife leaves for New York, Richard receives the news that his work is to be published and wires her aboard the ship she is travelling on - the RMS Titanic.

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: The aftermath of the Titanic disaster causes conflict within the household, as Miss Forrest gradually assumes more responsibility - and no one is more incensed than Lady Bellamy's personal maid, who escaped the tragedy on a life-raft.

programme.title: Doctor Finlay
programme.desc: Snowdrifts cut off Arden House on the night before Hogmanay, forcing Janet and the doctors to face a long evening huddled in front of a roaring fire. As the hours drag on, tempers wear thin and a few old scores are settled before the crowing cock heralds the dawn. Festive special of the Highland medical drama, starring David Rintoul, Ian Bannen, Jessica Turner and Annette Crosbie. Last in the series.

programme.title: The Glass

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Things are going strong between Jac and Jonny, until she hears a former lover is getting married and jeopardises everything she cares for. Holby is running like clockwork with Serena as CEO - can she hold on to the position when a competitor throws his hat into the ring? Chrissie has a health scare but is reluctant to confide in Sacha. Medical drama, starring Rosie Marcel, Michael Thomson, Tina Hobley and Catherine Russell.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Tess has to confront her own problems when a pregnant woman is involved in a road accident, while Robyn and Jamie witness the effects of a batch of bad pills on the Holby nightlife. Suzanne Packer, Amanda Henderson and Daniel Anthony star as the emergency medics.

programme.title: Deirfiúracha Na hEolaíochta
programme.desc: Róisín Ní Thomáin continues to profile Irish women who helped to shape the world of science by focusing on the achievements of Kathleen Lonsdale, whose pioneering work in the field of X-ray crystallography made her one of the most important chemists of the 20th century.

programme.title: Service
programme.desc: Rev Shannon De Laureal leads a service of worship and healing with the congregation of the North Tipperary Circuit of the methodist church and the Cloughjordan Community Choir.

programme.title: The Week in Politics
programme.desc: Aine Lawlor presents in-depth analysis of the past seven days' developments in politics.

programme.title: RTÉ News: One O'Clock and Farming Weather
Winning Streak
programme.desc: The National Lottery scratchcard game show that pits five contestants against each other in a series of games for the chance to win a cash prize of up to 1,000,000 euros.

programme.title: Natural World
programme.sub-title: Vultures: Beauty in the Beast - Natural World
programme.desc: Cameraman and naturalist Charlie Hamilton James travels to eastern Africa to try to show a different side to the much-maligned vulture, which he believes is a beautiful and intelligent bird that deserves respect. He reveals not only a softer, more caring side to the species, but also finds evidence that a carcass was deliberately poisoned and laid out for the raptors to feed on, resulting in numerous deaths.

programme.title: Country
programme.desc: A strong-willed woman fights to keep her farming family together when the loss of their crop in a tornado prompts an uncaring federal farming agency to foreclose on its loans and try to take away their home and land. Depression-era drama set in Iowa, starring Jessica Lange, Sam Shepard, Wilford Brimley and Matt Clark.

programme.title: School Around the Corner
programme.desc: Ray D'Arcy meets children from St Macartan's National School in Bundoran, Co Donegal, and Gardiner Street Primary School in Dublin, who discuss their fathers. Plus, rugby union player Donncha O'Callaghan finds that some things never change when he returns to his old school in Bishopstown, Cork. The programme includes a performance of a heavy metal classic by students of St Joseph's CBS primary in Louth.

programme.title: Ramadan Diary
programme.desc: Muslims from around Ireland share their experiences of marking the holy month with prayer and fasting.

programme.title: RTÉ News: Six One and Weather
programme.desc: The latest national and international headlines.

programme.title: Lords and Ladles
programme.desc: Derry Clarke, Catherine Fulvio and Paul Flynn visit Westport House, where a descendant of famous 16th-century sea trader Grace O'Malley regales them with historical tales.

programme.title: Room to Improve
programme.desc: Architect Dermot Bannon helps a client balance their taste for classic farmhouse design with his own clean, urban and functional style, while working on a tight schedule and limited budget.

programme.title: Fair City
programme.desc: Rachel rejects Amanda's offer of friendship, but later regrets her actions. Wayne and Orla fear that Caoimhe thinks they used her, and Tommy is cleared of robbing Jane's flat - but she is unrepentant about accusing him of the crime. Pete tries to make amends with Dolores, and tries to persuade Father Bertie to help him.

programme.title: RTÉ News: Nine O'Clock and Weather
programme.desc: The latest national and international news.

programme.title: Definitely, Maybe
programme.desc: A New York advertising executive on the eve of his divorce tells his daughter about his love life before he was married, including how he met her mother. However, he changes the names of his former lovers, leaving the girl - and viewers - to guess which one of three women he ended up marrying. Romantic comedy, starring Ryan Reynolds, Abigail Breslin, Elizabeth Banks, Rachel Weisz and Isla Fisher.

programme.title: The Week in Politics
programme.desc: Aine Lawlor presents in-depth analysis of the past seven days' developments in politics.

programme.title: Longmire
programme.desc: A media frenzy erupts when a corpse is discovered that could be the body of a man who disappeared 30 years previously. Henry decides to resolve his problems himself.

programme.title: Things We Lost in the Fire

When Brian is unexpectedly killed, his devastated widow Audrey invites Jerry to live with her and her children, and helps him to turn his life around. Drama, starring Halle Berry, Benicio Del Toro and David Duchovny.

Kush tries to hide his guilt when Nancy apologises about refusing to believe his claim that there is nothing going on between him and Stacey, while Vincent tries to explain where his stash of cash came from - and why he is hiding it.

programme.desc: Rachel rejects Amanda's offer of friendship, but later regrets her actions. Wayne and Orla fear that Caoimhe thinks they used her, and Tommy is cleared of robbing Jane's flat - but she is unrepentant about accusing him of the crime. Pete tries to make amends with Dolores, and tries to persuade Father Bertie to help him.

programme.title: How to Cook Well with Rory O'Connell

programme.title: Abhainn
programme.desc: Garry Mac Donncha follows the River Avoca, one of the country's most picturesque and historic waterways, which begins as the Avonmore river, before joining with the Avonbeg river, and finally flowing into the Irish Sea at Arklow. Among the activities the presenter throws himself into on his journey is putting some scouts going through their paces in Lough Dan, Co Wicklow.

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Shabnam is furious when Masood goes against her wishes and reports the attack to the police - but is that the only thing troubling her? Stacey tries to forget Kush by getting passionate with Martin, and Buster promises Shirley that he will find a way to make Jade a part of their lives. Patrick receives some advice from an old friend, Carol is in search of a distraction, and the sparks continue to fly between Roxy and Dean.

programme.title: Ear to the Ground
programme.desc: Helen Carroll explores how sheep commonage farmers in Co Mayo are struggling with ever changing EU regulations. Plus, Ella McSweeney investigates food labelling, and Darragh McCullough finds out about a technological advancement in Co Limerick.

programme.title: RTÉ News: Nine O'Clock and Weather
programme.desc: The latest national and international news.

programme.title: Independents' Day?
programme.desc: Irish politics used to be dominated by Fine Gael and Fianna Fail, but recently they have struggled to break 40 per cent in polls, with independent and smaller parties enjoying the support of more than a quarter of all voters. In this documentary, Pat Leahy examines the potential role of independent TDs in the Dáil after the next general election, with many coming together to form alliances and even new parties, and examines the reason behind their rise in popularity.

programme.title: Jean Kennedy Smith
programme.sub-title: Jean Kennedy Smith: Living in the Shadow of JFK
programme.desc: In an interview in her New York apartment, American diplomat and former US Ambassador to Ireland Jean Kennedy Smith talks about her life and career. She reveals what childhood in one of America's most famous families was like, discusses the constant sporting rivalry between her siblings, and talks about her brother John becoming president.

programme.title: Vegas
programme.desc: Dixon is pleasantly surprised when Violet invites him to visit her hotel room, but finds himself in a fix when she subsequently accuses him of assault. Lena has a wild night with a high-roller, but he is found dead the next morning, having left behind an angry creditor who just happens to be one of the Savoy's most lucrative customers.

Gordon Buchanan discovers an animal is stealing supplies and Steve Backshall finds giant piranha and long-fanged sabretooth fish in the river. Meanwhile, George McGavin catches an enormous tarantula and the climbing team tries to scale a huge unclimbed mountain at the forest's edge.

programme.desc: Westmeath v Meath (Throw-in 2.00pm) and Dublin v Kildare (Throw-in 4.00pm). Darragh Maloney presents coverage of the Leinster Senior Football semi-finals from Croke Park. Joe Brolly and Pat Spillane provide analysis of the games, and commentary comes from Ger Canning, Tom Carr, Marty Morrissey and Kevin McStay.

Spy adventure, starring George Lazenby in his only outing as 007, alongside Telly Savalas, Diana Rigg and Gabrielle Ferzetti.

programme.desc: Santiago and Diaz investigate Jake's claim that somebody is trying to sabotage his professional life and get him dismissed. Boyle partners up with Hitchcock and Scully to solve a tough case, while Jeffords lies to Gina claiming he and Holt attended her dance troupe's performance. Chris Parnell guest stars.

The murderer completed the crime by adding an extra place setting and putting Christmas music on the record player, but what was the motive? Guest starring Edward Asner as Hotch's father-in-law.

However, she's unaware that the man has close family ties to her captor. programme.desc: Josh loses his job thanks to Imogen's investigation into his employers. Nate becomes increasingly nervous about his date with Brett, and Brennan tries to build bridges with Tyler.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer heads to Jerusalem with Flanders and his Bible study group, but he is abandoned when he fails to take the trip seriously. Stranded in the desert, he has a hallucination that convinces him he is God's chosen one. With the guest voice of comedian Sacha Baron Cohen.

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Lonely Chris seeks solace with Marilyn and John, but ends up getting on their nerves. Leah throws Zac out after discovering he was planning to leave town before her recovery.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard and Sheldon's flat is burgled, so they work on a state-of-the-art security system in a bid to outwit any future would-be thieves. However, their plans go awry when they ensnare Penny in a net. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki and Jim Parsons.

programme.title: Selfie
programme.sub-title: A Little Yelp from My Friends
programme.desc: Henry and Eliza discover that their most valuable office relationship might be their own after Saperstein mandates his employees to work on their interpersonal connectivity skills. Comedy, starring Karen Gillan, John Cho and David Harewood.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.sub-title: A Ia La Aku (From This Day Forward)
programme.desc: The cops find themselves mingling with the rich and powerful when a guest at a high-society wedding is murdered. The bride becomes prime suspect when she goes missing - although things get altogether more interesting when they speak to the groom's mother. Rebecca De Mornay (Risky Business) guest stars.

programme.title: Gotham
programme.desc: Fish goes head-to-head with Maroni and Penguin to try to renew her claim on the city in the midst of a full-blown mob war that leaves Falcone in hospital. Meanwhile, Barbara agrees to undergo therapy with Leslie to help her get over her experience at the hands of the Ogre, and Bruce hunts for clues in his father's old study at Wayne Manor. But is he really prepared to deal with what he finds? Starring Ben McKenzie, Donal Logue, Jada Pinkett Smith and Sean Pertwee. Last in the series.

programme.title: Damo & Ivor
programme.desc: Sarah-Jane receives a declaration of love from Ivor, who then teams up with Damo and the lads to take Spuddy to a lap-dancing club for his stag do. Meanwhile, Tracey parties during a wild hen night with the girls and a stripper.

programme.title: Damo & Ivor
programme.desc: The day of the wedding arrives, and after a romantic ceremony Tracey and Sarah-Jane's waters break as Damo is giving his best man speech. Sarah-Jane discovers who the father of her baby is when the paternity results arrive. Last in the series.

programme.title: Soccer Republic
programme.desc: Magazine series presented by Peter Collins, focusing on Ireland's SSE Airtricity League and the fortunes of the international team.

programme.title: Xposé
programme.desc: Karen Koster, Aisling O'Loughlin, Glenda Gilson, Lisa Cannon and Peter O'Riordan present a round-up of stories from the world of showbusiness, covering everything from film premieres and awards ceremonies to concerts and fashion shows.

programme.title: The Great Irish Bake Off
programme.desc: The remaining three hopefuls fight to be crowned Best Amateur Baker in Ireland. Judge Paul Kelly sets a difficult technical challenge that pushes them to their limits, and they also must create their showstopper on one of the warmest days of the year. Presented by Anna Nolan. Last in the series.

programme.title: Ireland's Midwives
programme.desc: A woman opts for a home birth as she awaits the arrival of her second child, while another seeks her doctor's approval for a Caesarean section. Plus, the mother of a premature baby hopes her daughter will soon be able to leave intensive care and settle into her new home.

programme.title: The Best of Ireland AM
programme.desc: Magazine featuring a weekly round-up of health issues, entertainment news and personalities making the headlines.

programme.title: Strictly Irish Dancing
programme.desc: Part one of two. Documentary following competitors from Ireland, England and America as they prepare for the 2011 World Irish Dancing Championships, held in Dublin for the first time in 15 years. Includes interviews with Michael Flatley, Brendan de Gallai, Ronan McCormack and Karl Drake, plus those who make dresses and wigs for the dancers.

programme.title: Adoption Stories
programme.desc: The documentary features Geraldine, who was told her real mother had died but was introduced to the rest of her family. But there was a sting in the tail when the adoption agency revealed they not searched properly. Plus, the story of Sheila, who was sent to the US for adoption in the early 1960s, and still has the small case containing all her personal belongings that was sent with her. Although she was devoted to her adoptive parents, she has since spent a lot of time in Ireland with her extended family.

programme.title: Whiskey Business
programme.desc: As the arrival of the all-important copper pot stills looms, Jack and Stephen Teeling try to hold all the other aspects of building a whiskey distillery together. Security risks and bad weather are just some of the obstacles faced by the brothers in the run-up to this vital delivery.

programme.title: Stuart's Kitchen
programme.desc: Chef Stuart O'Keeffe prepares a dinner party, with dishes including a buffet of asparagus and Camembert cheese wrapped with prosciutto, tomato and goat's cheese cream bruschetta with herb oil, and a caramelised banana sundae. He does not believe a host should cook alone, and gets his guests to help in the kitchen.

programme.title: Stuart's Kitchen
programme.desc: The chef advocates a filling meal after a stressful day or hard workout, so he prepares a grilled cheese and sirloin steak sandwich, spaghetti with mushy peas, roast tomato and garlic soup, and Irish sausages and ricotta cheese. Plus, he puts together chewy pecan bars - one of his favourite snacks. Last in the series.

programme.title: Furry Vengeance
programme.desc: A real estate developer believes he has hit upon a winning idea when he proposes a new housing project on the site of a forested area. However, his plan faces stern protests from a host of woodland creatures eager to protect their homes. Family comedy, starring Brendan Fraser, Brooke Shields and Ken Jeong.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: TV presenter Fern Britton, former England cricketer Matthew Hoggard, lingerie tycoon Michelle Mone and actor Neil Morrissey pit their general knowledge against a trivia expert as they try to win thousands of pounds for charity. However, they must work as a team to build their prize pot and stay one step ahead of the Chaser. Bradley Walsh hosts.

programme.title: The Cube
programme.desc: Phillip Schofield presents as two more contestants - call centre manager Jamie from Edinburgh and project engineer Dean from Cardiff - are asked to complete tasks within the confines of a large transparent cube in a bid to win a £250,000 jackpot. Each player has nine lives and must complete up to seven challenges, ranging from agility tests to skill trials. Last in the series.

programme.title: Big Star's Little Star
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern is joined by three celebrity contestants and their children, who will tell revealing stories about their home life in the hope of winning £15,000 for charity. Squirming uncomfortably for the jackpot are musician-turned-cheesemaker Alex James with his twin boys Artie and Gally, TV presenter Michaela Strachan and her son Oliver, and chef Aldo Zilli with his daughter Twiggy.

programme.title: Celebrity Squares
programme.desc: Legendary entertainer Dame Edna Everage, Emmerdale's Lucy Pargeter (Chas Dingle), comedians Patrick Monahan and Rufus Hound, Britain's Got Talent 2012 winners Ashleigh and Pudsey, TV presenter Carol Vorderman and comedienne Roisin Conaty join Tim Vine and Joe Wilkinson in the grid, as contestants take on the Noughts-and-Crosses-style challenge. The participants have to say whether they agree or disagree with the general-knowledge answers given by the famous faces inside each box. If they are correct they claim that square, and the first to get three in a line wins the round and the money. One person then goes on to play for the star prize. Warwick Davis hosts the revived game show.

programme.title: Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts the game show, asking three contestants to `see it and say it' as they try to guess the familiar phrases hidden in animated clues. After the first elimination, the two remaining players battle to reach the Super Catchphrase round, where one of them could win £50,000.

programme.title: All Star Family Fortunes
programme.desc: Coronation Street special in which Andy Whyment (Kirk Sutherland) and Debbie Rush (Anna Windass) compete to win a cash prize for charity. The two teams try to guess the answers to surveys of 100 people in a bid to reach the final round, in which they can win up to £30,000 for a charity of their choice. Presented by Vernon Kay. Last in the series.

programme.title: Big Brother
programme.desc: Daily round-up of highlights, revealing how the housemates are getting on under the all-seeing eye of Big Brother, featuring the latest tasks, games, arguments, laughs, diary room visits and bedroom chit-chat. Narrated by Marcus Bentley.

programme.title: Sex and the City 2
programme.desc: Fashion-conscious writer Carrie finds married life is not all she expected, while her friends are struggling with problems of their own. They decide to recapture their days of being single and carefree with a trip to Abu Dhabi, but their luxury holiday is beset with disasters. Comedy sequel, with Sarah Jessica Parker, Kristin Davis, Cynthia Nixon and Kim Cattrall.

programme.title: Paul Connolly Investigates
programme.sub-title: Ireland's Secret Sex Lives: Paul Connolly Investigates
programme.desc: The journalist turns his attention to the role of sex in modern Ireland. He explores the crazes of swinging, fetishism and dogging, as he infiltrates the country's underground sex scene, and speaks to the ordinary men and women who drive it.

programme.title: The Best of Ireland AM
programme.desc: Magazine featuring a weekly round-up of health issues, entertainment news and personalities making the headlines.

programme.title: Teleshopping

programme.desc: Karen Koster, Aisling O'Loughlin, Glenda Gilson, Lisa Cannon and Peter O'Riordan present a round-up of stories from the world of showbusiness, covering everything from film premieres and awards ceremonies to concerts and fashion shows.

programme.title: Ireland AM
programme.desc: Magazine programme featuring health, politics and education reports, entertainment news and interviews with personalities making the headlines. With hosts Mark Cagney, Sinead Desmond, Alan Hughes, Aidan Cooney and Anna Daly.

programme.title: The Jeremy Kyle Show
programme.desc: The host invites guests to air their differences over family and relationship issues, and provides them with his own brand of no-nonsense advice.

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.desc: Real-life small-claims cases on issues affecting family life, presided over by outspoken former New York judge Judy Sheindlin.

programme.title: Midday

programme.title: News at 12:30
programme.desc: Colette Fitzpatrick presents the headlines at lunchtime.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Quiz show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: Xposé
programme.desc: Karen Koster, Aisling O'Loughlin, Glenda Gilson, Lisa Cannon and Peter O'Riordan present a round-up of stories from the world of showbusiness, covering everything from film premieres and awards ceremonies to concerts and fashion shows.

programme.title: Wimbledon 2015
programme.desc: Action from the opening day's play at the All England Club, as all eyes focus on Centre Court and the first-round match on day one featuring defending men's singles champion Novak Djokovic. The Serbian world number one has the honour of being first on the showpiece court following his thrilling five-set victory over Roger Federer in last year's final, which saw him win the title for the second time and succeed Andy Murray as champion. Djokovic's win also moved him to the top of the world rankings, and the 28-year-old has gone from strength to strength since, establishing himself as the man to beat once again during the forthcoming fortnight in the third Grand Slam tournament of the year. The Centre Court schedule last year began with Murray against David Goffin, which gave the British number one the ideal opening to his defence, easing his way into an event which would ultimately end in disappointment with a quarter-final defeat to Grigor Dimitrov. Li Na, who has since retired from the women's game, followed Murray onto court and also progressed in straight sets, with wins for Djokovic and Dominika Cibulkova concluding the day's entertainment on the most famous court in tennis.(n)
